verses.kjv: The word that the LORD spake against Babylon and against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.web: The word that LORD spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.ct: This is the message the LORD spoke through the prophet Jeremiah against Babylon and the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: Declare ye among the nations, and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and conceal not: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is confounded, Merodach is broken in pieces; her idols are confounded, her images are broken in pieces.
verses.web: “Declare among the nations and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and don’t conceal: say, ‘Babylon has been taken, Bel is disappointed, Merodach is dismayed! Her images are disappointed. Her idols are dismayed.’
verses.ct: "Announce it to the nations! Proclaim it and raise a signal flag! Don't hold anything back — declare it: 'Babylon has fallen! Her god Bel is humiliated, and Merodach is shattered! Her idols are disgraced, and her images are smashed to pieces.'

verses.kjv: For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they shall remove, they shall depart, both man and beast.
verses.web: For a nation comes up out of the north against her, which will make her land desolate, and no one will dwell in it. They have fled. They are gone, both man and animal.
verses.ct: A nation from the north is coming to attack her. It will turn her land into a wasteland where no one lives. Every person and every animal will flee and be gone.

verses.kjv: In those days, and in that time, saith the LORD, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together, going and weeping: they shall go, and seek the LORD their God.
verses.web: “In those days, and in that time,” says LORD, “the children of Israel will come, they and the children of Judah together; they will go on their way weeping, and will seek LORD their God.
verses.ct: "When that time comes," says the LORD, "the people of Israel and the people of Judah will come together, weeping as they go, searching for the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: They shall ask the way to Zion with their faces thitherward, saying, Come, and let us join ourselves to the LORD in a perpetual covenant that shall not be forgotten.
verses.web: They will inquire concerning Zion with their faces turned toward it, saying, ‘Come, and join yourselves to LORD in an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.’
verses.ct: They will ask the way to Zion, turning their faces toward it, saying, 'Come, let's bind ourselves to the LORD in an everlasting covenant that will never be forgotten.'

verses.kjv: My people hath been lost sheep: their shepherds have caused them to go astray, they have turned them away on the mountains: they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their restingplace.
verses.web: My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds have caused them to go astray. They have turned them away on the mountains. They have gone from mountain to hill. They have forgotten their resting place.
verses.ct: My people have been like lost sheep. Their own leaders led them astray, driving them off course into the mountains. They wandered from mountain to hill until they forgot where they belonged.

verses.kjv: All that found them have devoured them: and their adversaries said, We offend not, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of justice, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.
verses.web: All who found them have devoured them. Their adversaries said, ‘We are not guilty, because they have sinned against LORD, the habitation of righteousness, even LORD, the hope of their fathers.’
verses.ct: Everyone who found them devoured them. Their enemies said, 'We've done nothing wrong — they're the ones who sinned against the LORD, the true dwelling place of righteousness, the LORD, the hope of their ancestors.'

verses.kjv: Remove out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he goats before the flocks.
verses.web: “Flee out of the middle of Babylon! Go out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the male goats before the flocks.
verses.ct: "Get out of Babylon! Leave the land of the Chaldeans! Be like the lead goats that march at the front of the flock.

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country: and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken: their arrows shall be as of a mighty expert man; none shall return in vain.
verses.web: For, behold, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country; and they will set themselves in array against her. She will be taken from there. Their arrows will be as of an expert mighty man. None of them will return in vain.
verses.ct: Watch — I am going to stir up and send against Babylon a coalition of powerful nations from the north. They will line up for battle against her, and she will be captured. Their arrows will fly like those of a skilled warrior — not one will miss its mark.

verses.kjv: And Chaldea shall be a spoil: all that spoil her shall be satisfied, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Chaldea will be a prey. All who prey on her will be satisfied,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Chaldea will be plundered, and everyone who loots her will get their fill," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Because ye were glad, because ye rejoiced, O ye destroyers of mine heritage, because ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, and bellow as bulls;
verses.web: “Because you are glad, because you rejoice, O you who plunder my heritage, because you are wanton as a heifer that treads out the grain, and neigh as strong horses;
verses.ct: "You celebrated and rejoiced, you who plundered my people! You grew fat like a well-fed cow grazing in a meadow and neighed like powerful stallions.

verses.kjv: Your mother shall be sore confounded; she that bare you shall be ashamed: behold, the hindermost of the nations shall be a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
verses.web: your mother will be utterly disappointed. She who bore you will be confounded. Behold, she will be the least of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
verses.ct: But your mother will be utterly disgraced — the nation that gave you birth will be put to shame. She will become the least of all nations — a wilderness, a dry and barren desert.

verses.kjv: Because of the wrath of the LORD it shall not be inhabited, but it shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.
verses.web: Because of LORD’s wrath she won’t be inhabited, but she will be wholly desolate. Everyone who goes by Babylon will be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.
verses.ct: Because of the LORD's fury, no one will live there. The whole place will be completely deserted. Everyone who passes by Babylon will be horrified and gasp at all her wounds.

verses.kjv: Put yourselves in array against Babylon round about: all ye that bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned against the LORD.
verses.web: Set yourselves in array against Babylon all around, all you who bend the bow; shoot at her. Spare no arrows; for she has sinned against LORD.
verses.ct: Take your positions around Babylon, all you archers! Shoot at her — don't hold back a single arrow — because she has sinned against the LORD.

verses.kjv: Shout against her round about: she hath given her hand: her foundations are fallen, her walls are thrown down: for it is the vengeance of the LORD: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done, do unto her.
verses.web: Shout against her all around. She has submitted herself. Her bulwarks have fallen. Her walls have been thrown down, for it is the vengeance of LORD. Take vengeance on her. As she has done, do to her.
verses.ct: Raise the war cry against her from every side! She has surrendered! Her defenses have crumbled, and her walls have been torn down. This is the LORD's vengeance — so take your vengeance on her! Do to her exactly what she has done to others.

verses.kjv: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.
verses.web: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him who handles the sickle in the time of harvest. For fear of the oppressing sword, they will each return to their own people, and they will each flee to their own land.
verses.ct: Cut off the farmers who plant in Babylon and the workers who swing the sickle at harvest time. Because of the invader's deadly sword, every foreigner will run back to their own people and flee to their own land.

verses.kjv: Israel is a scattered sheep; the lions have driven him away: first the king of Assyria hath devoured him; and last this Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
verses.web: “Israel is a hunted sheep. The lions have driven him away. First, the king of Assyria devoured him, and now at last Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.”
verses.ct: "Israel is a scattered sheep that lions have chased down. First the king of Assyria devoured him, and now finally Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has crushed his bones."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
verses.web: Therefore LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "Watch — I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land, just as I punished the king of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And I will bring Israel again to his habitation, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon mount Ephraim and Gilead.
verses.web: I will bring Israel again to his pasture, and he will feed on Carmel and Bashan. His soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.
verses.ct: I will bring Israel back to his own pastureland. He will graze on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.

verses.kjv: In those days, and in that time, saith the LORD, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I reserve.
verses.web: In those days, and in that time,” says LORD, “the iniquity of Israel will be sought for, and there will be none; also the sins of Judah, and they won’t be found; for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.
verses.ct: When that time comes," says the LORD, "people will search for Israel's guilt, but there will be none. They will look for Judah's sins, but they won't find any — because I will forgive the remnant I have spared."

verses.kjv: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the LORD, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
verses.web: “Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod. Kill and utterly destroy after them,” says LORD, “and do according to all that I have commanded you.
verses.ct: "March against the land of Merathaim and against the people of Pekod! Slaughter them and completely destroy everything behind you," says the LORD. "Carry out every command I have given you.

verses.kjv: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
verses.web: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
verses.ct: The sound of battle fills the land — the noise of massive destruction!

verses.kjv: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
verses.web: How the hammer of the whole earth is cut apart and broken! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
verses.ct: How the hammer that smashed the whole earth has itself been cut apart and shattered! How Babylon has become a horror among the nations!

verses.kjv: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware: thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against the LORD.
verses.web: I have laid a snare for you, and you are also taken, Babylon, and you weren’t aware. You are found, and also caught, because you have fought against LORD.
verses.ct: I set a trap for you, Babylon, and you were caught before you even knew it. You were discovered and seized because you fought against the LORD.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath opened his armoury, and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation: for this is the work of the Lord GOD of hosts in the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.web: LORD has opened his armory, and has brought out the weapons of his indignation; for the Lord, LORD of Armies, has a work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: The LORD has thrown open his armory and brought out the weapons of his fury, because the Lord GOD of hosts has work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: Come against her from the utmost border, open her storehouses: cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly: let nothing of her be left.
verses.web: Come against her from the farthest border. Open her storehouses. Cast her up as heaps. Destroy her utterly. Let nothing of her be left.
verses.ct: Come at her from every direction! Break open her storehouses! Pile her up like heaps of rubble and destroy her completely — leave nothing behind.

verses.kjv: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
verses.web: Kill all her bulls. Let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them! For their day has come, the time of their visitation.
verses.ct: Kill all her warriors — send them to the slaughter! Disaster has come for them, because their day of reckoning has arrived.

verses.kjv: The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.web: Listen to those who flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of LORD our God, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.ct: Listen to the refugees fleeing and escaping from Babylon, rushing to announce in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God — his vengeance for what was done to his temple.

verses.kjv: Call together the archers against Babylon: all ye that bend the bow, camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she hath done, do unto her: for she hath been proud against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.web: “Call together the archers against Babylon, all those who bend the bow. Encamp against her all around. Let none of it escape. Pay her back according to her work. According to all that she has done, do to her; for she has been proud against LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: "Call up the archers against Babylon — everyone who can draw a bow! Set up camp around her on every side. Don't let anyone escape. Pay her back for what she has done. Do to her exactly as she did to others, because she acted with arrogance against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall her young men fall in the streets, and all her men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Therefore her young men will fall in her streets. All her men of war will be brought to silence in that day,” says LORD.
verses.ct: That is why her young men will fall dead in her streets, and all her soldiers will be silenced on that day," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord GOD of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
verses.web: “Behold, I am against you, you proud one,” says the Lord, LORD of Armies; “for your day has come, the time that I will visit you.
verses.ct: "I am against you, you arrogant one," declares the Lord GOD of hosts. "Your day has come — the time when I will deal with you.

verses.kjv: And the most proud shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all round about him.
verses.web: The proud one will stumble and fall, and no one will raise him up. I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it will devour all who are around him.”
verses.ct: The arrogant one will stumble and fall with no one to help him up. I will set fire to his cities, and the flames will consume everything around him."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; The children of Israel and the children of Judah were oppressed together: and all that took them captives held them fast; they refused to let them go.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together. All who took them captive hold them fast. They refuse to let them go.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of hosts says: "The people of Israel and the people of Judah are oppressed together. Everyone who captured them holds them tight and refuses to let them go.

verses.kjv: Their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name: he shall throughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.web: Their Redeemer is strong: LORD of Armies is his name. He will thoroughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the earth, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.ct: But their Redeemer is strong — the LORD of hosts is his name. He will fight their case with power, bringing peace to their land and turmoil to the people of Babylon."

verses.kjv: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith the LORD, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
verses.web: “A sword is on the Chaldeans,” says LORD, “and on the inhabitants of Babylon, on her princes, and on her wise men.
verses.ct: "A sword is coming against the Chaldeans," says the LORD, "against the people of Babylon, against her officials, and against her wise men.

verses.kjv: A sword is upon the liars; and they shall dote: a sword is upon her mighty men; and they shall be dismayed.
verses.web: A sword is on the boasters, and they will become fools. A sword is on her mighty men, and they will be dismayed.
verses.ct: A sword is coming against her false prophets — they will be exposed as fools. A sword is coming against her warriors — they will be paralyzed with fear.

verses.kjv: A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women: a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be robbed.
verses.web: A sword is on their horses, on their chariots, and on all the mixed people who are in the middle of her; and they will become as women. A sword is on her treasures, and they will be robbed.
verses.ct: A sword is coming against her horses, her chariots, and all the foreign troops within her — they will become as helpless as children. A sword is coming against her treasures — they will be plundered.

verses.kjv: A drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dried up: for it is the land of graven images, and they are mad upon their idols.
verses.web: A drought is on her waters, and they will be dried up; for it is a land of engraved images, and they are mad over idols.
verses.ct: A drought is coming against her waters — they will dry up. For Babylon is a land obsessed with carved images; her people have gone mad over their idols.

verses.kjv: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wild beasts of the islands shall dwell there, and the owls shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
verses.web: Therefore the wild animals of the desert with the wolves will dwell there. The ostriches will dwell therein; and it will be inhabited no more forever; neither will it be lived in from generation to generation.
verses.ct: So desert creatures and wild wolves will live there, and ostriches will make it their home. No one will ever live there again — it will remain empty from generation to generation.

verses.kjv: As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the LORD; so shall no man abide there, neither shall any son of man dwell therein.
verses.web: As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and its neighbor cities,” says LORD, “so no man will dwell there, neither will any son of man live therein.
verses.ct: Just as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the towns around them," says the LORD, "no one will live there. No human being will ever settle in it again.

verses.kjv: Behold, a people shall come from the north, and a great nation, and many kings shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.
verses.web: “Behold, a people comes from the north; and a great nation and many kings will be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
verses.ct: "Look — a people is coming from the north! A great nation and many kings are being roused from the farthest corners of the earth.

verses.kjv: They shall hold the bow and the lance: they are cruel, and will not shew mercy: their voice shall roar like the sea, and they shall ride upon horses, every one put in array, like a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
verses.web: They take up bow and spear. They are cruel, and have no mercy. Their voice roars like the sea. They ride on horses, everyone set in array, as a man to the battle, against you, daughter of Babylon.
verses.ct: They carry bows and spears. They are cruel and show no mercy. Their battle cry roars like the ocean. They ride on horses, lined up in formation like warriors ready for battle — all coming against you, daughter of Babylon.

verses.kjv: The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, and his hands waxed feeble: anguish took hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
verses.web: The king of Babylon has heard the news of them, and his hands become feeble: anguish has taken hold of him, pains as of a woman in labor.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon has heard the reports about them, and his hands go limp. Anguish grips him — pain like a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: Behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan unto the habitation of the strong: but I will make them suddenly run away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
verses.web: Behold, the enemy will come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation; for I will suddenly make them run away from it. Whoever is chosen, I will appoint him over it; for who is like me? Who will appoint me a time? Who is the shepherd who can stand before me?”
verses.ct: Like a lion coming up from the thick brush along the Jordan to attack a fortified pasture, I will suddenly chase Babylon away from her land. And who is the one I will choose to put in charge of her? For who is like me? Who can challenge me? What leader can stand against me?"

verses.kjv: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the LORD, that he hath taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the least of the flock shall draw them out: surely he shall make their habitation desolate with them.
verses.web: Therefore hear the counsel of LORD, that he has taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely they will drag them away, even the little ones of the flock. Surely he will make their habitation desolate over them.
verses.ct: So listen to the plan the LORD has made against Babylon — the purposes he has formed against the land of the Chaldeans: Even the weakest of the flock will drag them away. He will turn their homeland into a wasteland because of them.

verses.kjv: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved, and the cry is heard among the nations.
verses.web: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth trembles; and the cry is heard among the nations.
verses.ct: At the sound of Babylon's capture, the earth shakes, and the cry echoes among the nations.
